EmailTemplate.name: July Emails 2018.Spring Cloud GCP - 7-3-18
EmailTemplate.subject: 7/12 Webinar - Spring on Google Cloud Platform
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Please join us for the webinar Spring on Google Cloud Platform, <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/jul-12-spring-on-google-cloud-platform-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=spring on google cloud&utm_term=q318]]> on July 12, 2018.
Pivotal and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) collaborate on a number of projects—including Pivotal Cloud Foundry Service Broker for GCP and Spring Boot starters—that make it easy to leverage GCP's managed services, whether you are starting a new project or migrating an existing on-premise project.
In this talk, we'll examine different GCP-created tools that help you develop and run Java and Spring applications, such as Spring Cloud GCP. In addition, we'll look at the different runtime environments that you can deploy to, such as Google Kubernetes Engine, App Engine, and Pivotal Cloud Foundry with GCP Service Broker.
Finally, we'll go over some of the platform services that help you monitor, troubleshoot, profile, and debug your Java production application.
Presenter: Ray Tsang, Google
Date: Thursday, July 12, 2018 Time: 10:00am PDT / 1:00pm EDT
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/jul-12-spring-on-google-cloud-platform-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=spring on google cloud&utm_term=q318]]>
We thank you in advance for joining us. The Spring by Pivotal Team
© 2018 Pivotal Software, Inc. 875 Howard Street <[[https://www.google.com/maps?q=875+Howard+Street&entry=gmail&source=g]]>, Fifth Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103. Published in the USA.
